Enums.name: ListSortOrder
Enums.description: The available sorting options when requesting a list of response objects.

Enums.name: MessageRole
Enums.description: The possible values for roles attributed to messages in a thread.

Enums.name: RunStatus

values.name: queued
values.description: Represents a run that is queued to start.

values.name: inProgress
values.description: Represents a run that is in progress.

values.name: requiresAction
values.description: Represents a run that needs another operation, such as tool output submission, to continue.

values.name: cancelling
values.description: Represents a run that is in the process of cancellation.

values.name: cancelled
values.description: Represents a run that has been cancelled.

values.name: completed
values.description: Represents a run that successfully completed.

values.name: expired
values.description: Represents a run that expired before it could otherwise finish.

Enums.description: Possible values for the status of an assistant thread run.

Enums.name: RunStepType

values.name: messageCreation
values.description: Represents a run step to create a message.

values.name: toolCalls
values.description: Represents a run step that calls tools.

Enums.description: The possible types of run steps.

Enums.name: RunStepStatus

values.name: inProgress
values.description: Represents a run step still in progress.

values.name: cancelled
values.description: Represents a run step that was cancelled.

values.name: failed
values.description: Represents a run step that failed.

values.name: completed
values.description: Represents a run step that successfully completed.

values.name: expired
values.description: Represents a run step that expired before otherwise finishing.

Enums.description: Possible values for the status of a run step.

Enums.name: RunStepErrorCode

values.name: rateLimitExceeded
values.description: Represents an error indicating configured rate limits were exceeded.

Enums.description: Possible error code values attributable to a failed run step.

Enums.name: OpenAIFilePurpose

values.name: fineTune
values.description: Indicates a file is used for fine tuning input.

values.name: fineTuneResults
values.description: Indicates a file is used for fine tuning results.

values.name: assistants
values.description: Indicates a file is used as input to assistants.

values.name: assistantsOutput
values.description: Indicates a file is used as output by assistants.

Enums.description: The possible values denoting the intended usage of a file.

Enums.name: ServiceApiVersions

values.name: v2024_02_15_preview
values.description: The initial version of Azure OpenAI Assistants that corresponds to functionality in OpenAI's first beta release.

Enums.description: The known set of supported API versions.

Models.name: AssistantCreationOptions
Models.description: The request details to use when creating a new assistant.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The ID of the model to use.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the new assistant.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the new assistant.

properties.name: instructions
properties.description: The system instructions for the new assistant to use.

properties.name: tools
properties.description: The collection of tools to enable for the new assistant.

valueType.name: ToolDefinition
valueType.description: An abstract representation of an input tool definition that an assistant can use.

code_interpreter.name: CodeInterpreterToolDefinition
code_interpreter.description: The input definition information for a code interpreter tool as used to configure an assistant.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'code_interpreter'.

retrieval.name: RetrievalToolDefinition
retrieval.description: The input definition information for a retrieval tool as used to configure an assistant.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'retrieval'.

function.name: FunctionToolDefinition
function.description: The input definition information for a function tool as used to configure an assistant.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'function'.

properties.name: InternalFunction
properties.description: The definition of the concrete function that the function tool should call.

type.name: InternalFunctionDefinition
type.description: The input definition information for a function.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function to be called.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object.

properties.name: fileIds
properties.description: A list of previously uploaded file IDs to attach to the assistant.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: Assistant
Models.description: Represents an assistant that can call the model and use tools.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always assistant.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this object was created.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the assistant.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the assistant.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The ID of the model to use.

properties.name: instructions
properties.description: The system instructions for the assistant to use.

properties.name: tools
properties.description: The collection of tools enabled for the assistant.

properties.name: fileIds
properties.description: A list of attached file IDs, ordered by creation date in ascending order.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: OpenAIPageableListOfAssistant
Models.description: The response data for a requested list of items.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always list.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The requested list of items.

properties.name: firstId
properties.description: The first ID represented in this list.

properties.name: lastId
properties.description: The last ID represented in this list.

properties.name: hasMore
properties.description: A value indicating whether there are additional values available not captured in this list.

Models.name: UpdateAssistantOptions
Models.description: The request details to use when modifying an existing assistant.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The ID of the model to use.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The modified name for the assistant to use.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The modified description for the assistant to use.

properties.name: instructions
properties.description: The modified system instructions for the new assistant to use.

properties.name: tools
properties.description: The modified collection of tools to enable for the assistant.

properties.name: fileIds
properties.description: The modified list of previously uploaded fileIDs to attach to the assistant.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: InternalAssistantDeletionStatus
Models.description: The status of an assistant deletion operation.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the resource specified for deletion.

properties.name: deleted
properties.description: A value indicating whether deletion was successful.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'assistant.deleted'.

properties.name: fileId
properties.description: The ID of the previously uploaded file to attach.

Models.name: AssistantFile
Models.description: Information about a file attached to an assistant, as used by tools that can read files.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'assistant.file'.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this object was created.

properties.name: assistantId
properties.description: The assistant ID that the file is attached to.

Models.name: OpenAIPageableListOfAssistantFile
Models.description: The response data for a requested list of items.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always list.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The requested list of items.

properties.name: firstId
properties.description: The first ID represented in this list.

properties.name: lastId
properties.description: The last ID represented in this list.

properties.name: hasMore
properties.description: A value indicating whether there are additional values available not captured in this list.

Models.name: InternalAssistantFileDeletionStatus
Models.description: The status of an assistant file deletion operation.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the resource specified for deletion.

properties.name: deleted
properties.description: A value indicating whether deletion was successful.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'assistant.file.deleted'.

Models.name: AssistantThreadCreationOptions
Models.description: The details used to create a new assistant thread.

properties.name: messages
properties.description: The initial messages to associate with the new thread.

valueType.name: ThreadInitializationMessage
valueType.description: A single message within an assistant thread, as provided during that thread's creation for its initial state.

properties.name: role
properties.description: The role associated with the assistant thread message. Currently, only 'user' is supported when providing initial messages to a new thread.

properties.name: content
properties.description: The textual content of the initial message. Currently, robust input including images and annotated text may only be provided via a separate call to the create message API.

properties.name: fileIds
properties.description:
A list of file IDs that the assistant should use. Useful for tools like retrieval and code_interpreter that can
access files.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: AssistantThread
Models.description: Information about a single thread associated with an assistant.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'thread'.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this object was created.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: ThreadDeletionStatus
Models.description: The status of a thread deletion operation.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the resource specified for deletion.

properties.name: deleted
properties.description: A value indicating whether deletion was successful.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'thread.deleted'.

properties.name: role
properties.description: The role to associate with the new message.

properties.name: content
properties.description: The textual content for the new message.

properties.name: fileIds
properties.description: A list of up to 10 file IDs to associate with the message, as used by tools like 'code_interpreter' or 'retrieval' that can read files.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: ThreadMessage
Models.description: A single, existing message within an assistant thread.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'thread.message'.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this object was created.

properties.name: threadId
properties.description: The ID of the thread that this message belongs to.

properties.name: role
properties.description: The role associated with the assistant thread message.

properties.name: ContentItems
properties.description: The list of content items associated with the assistant thread message.

valueType.name: MessageContent
valueType.description: An abstract representation of a single item of thread message content.

text.name: MessageTextContent
text.description: A representation of a textual item of thread message content.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'text'.

properties.name: InternalDetails
properties.description: The text and associated annotations for this thread message content item.

type.name: InternalMessageTextDetails
type.description: The text and associated annotations for a single item of assistant thread message content.

properties.name: Text
properties.description: The text data.

properties.name: annotations
properties.description: A list of annotations associated with this text.

valueType.name: MessageTextAnnotation
valueType.description: An abstract representation of an annotation to text thread message content.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The textual content associated with this text annotation item.

properties.name: startIndex
properties.description: The first text index associated with this text annotation.

properties.name: endIndex
properties.description: The last text index associated with this text annotation.

file_citation.name: MessageTextFileCitationAnnotation
file_citation.description: A citation within the message that points to a specific quote from a specific File associated with the assistant or the message. Generated when the assistant uses the 'retrieval' tool to search files.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'file_citation'.

properties.name: InternalDetails
properties.description:
A citation within the message that points to a specific quote from a specific file.
Generated when the assistant uses the "retrieval" tool to search files.

type.name: InternalMessageTextFileCitationDetails
type.description: A representation of a file-based text citation, as used in a file-based annotation of text thread message content.

properties.name: fileId
properties.description: The ID of the file associated with this citation.

properties.name: quote
properties.description: The specific quote cited in the associated file.

file_path.name: MessageTextFilePathAnnotation
file_path.description: A citation within the message that points to a file located at a specific path.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'file_path'.

properties.name: InternalDetails
properties.description: A URL for the file that's generated when the assistant used the code_interpreter tool to generate a file.

type.name: InternalMessageTextFilePathDetails
type.description: An encapsulation of an image file ID, as used by message image content.

properties.name: fileId
properties.description: The ID of the specific file that the citation is from.

image_file.name: MessageImageFileContent
image_file.description: A representation of image file content in a thread message.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'image_file'.

properties.name: InternalDetails
properties.description: The image file for this thread message content item.

type.name: InternalMessageImageFileDetails
type.description: An image reference, as represented in thread message content.

properties.name: InternalDetails
properties.description: The ID for the file associated with this image.

properties.name: assistantId
properties.description: If applicable, the ID of the assistant that authored this message.

properties.name: runId
properties.description: If applicable, the ID of the run associated with the authoring of this message.

properties.name: fileIds
properties.description:
A list of file IDs that the assistant should use. Useful for tools like retrieval and code_interpreter that can
access files.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: OpenAIPageableListOfThreadMessage
Models.description: The response data for a requested list of items.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always list.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The requested list of items.

properties.name: firstId
properties.description: The first ID represented in this list.

properties.name: lastId
properties.description: The last ID represented in this list.

properties.name: hasMore
properties.description: A value indicating whether there are additional values available not captured in this list.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: OpenAIPageableListOfMessageFile
Models.description: The response data for a requested list of items.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always list.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The requested list of items.

valueType.name: MessageFile
valueType.description: Information about a file attached to an assistant thread message.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'thread.message.file'.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this object was created.

properties.name: messageId
properties.description: The ID of the message that this file is attached to.

properties.name: firstId
properties.description: The first ID represented in this list.

properties.name: lastId
properties.description: The last ID represented in this list.

properties.name: hasMore
properties.description: A value indicating whether there are additional values available not captured in this list.

Models.name: CreateRunOptions
Models.description: The details used when creating a new run of an assistant thread.

properties.name: assistantId
properties.description: The ID of the assistant that should run the thread.

properties.name: OverrideModelName
properties.description: The overridden model name that the assistant should use to run the thread.

properties.name: OverrideInstructions
properties.description: The overridden system instructions that the assistant should use to run the thread.

properties.name: additionalInstructions
properties.description:
Additional instructions to append at the end of the instructions for the run. This is useful for modifying the behavior
on a per-run basis without overriding other instructions.

properties.name: OverrideTools
properties.description: The overridden list of enabled tools that the assistant should use to run the thread.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: ThreadRun
Models.description: Data representing a single evaluation run of an assistant thread.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'thread.run'.

properties.name: threadId
properties.description: The ID of the thread associated with this run.

properties.name: assistantId
properties.description: The ID of the assistant associated with the thread this run was performed against.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the assistant thread run.

properties.name: requiredAction
properties.description: The details of the action required for the assistant thread run to continue.

type.name: RequiredAction
type.description: An abstract representation of a required action for an assistant thread run to continue.

submit_tool_outputs.name: SubmitToolOutputsAction
submit_tool_outputs.description: The details for required tool calls that must be submitted for an assistant thread run to continue.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'submit_tool_outputs'.

properties.name: InternalDetails
properties.description: The details describing tools that should be called to submit tool outputs.

type.name: InternalSubmitToolOutputsDetails
type.description: The details describing tools that should be called to submit tool outputs.

properties.name: toolCalls
properties.description: The list of tool calls that must be resolved for the assistant thread run to continue.

valueType.name: RequiredToolCall
valueType.description: An abstract representation a a tool invocation needed by the model to continue a run.

discriminatorProperty.name: type
discriminatorProperty.description: The object type for the required tool call.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the tool call. This ID must be referenced when submitting tool outputs.

function.name: RequiredFunctionToolCall
function.description: A representation of a requested call to a function tool, needed by the model to continue evaluation of a run.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type of the required tool call. Always 'function' for function tools.

properties.name: InternalDetails
properties.description: Detailed information about the function to be executed by the tool that includes name and arguments.

type.name: InternalRequiredFunctionToolCallDetails
type.description: The detailed information for a function invocation, as provided by a required action invoking a function tool, that includes the name of and arguments to the function.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function.

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: The arguments to use when invoking the named function, as provided by the model. Arguments are presented as a JSON document that should be validated and parsed for evaluation.

properties.name: lastError
properties.description: The last error, if any, encountered by this assistant thread run.

type.name: RunError
type.description: The details of an error as encountered by an assistant thread run.

properties.name: code
properties.description: The status for the error.

properties.name: message
properties.description: The human-readable text associated with the error.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The ID of the model to use.

properties.name: instructions
properties.description: The overridden system instructions used for this assistant thread run.

properties.name: tools
properties.description: The overridden enabled tools used for this assistant thread run.

properties.name: fileIds
properties.description: A list of attached file IDs, ordered by creation date in ascending order.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this object was created.

properties.name: expiresAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this item expires.

properties.name: startedAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this item was started.

properties.name: completedAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this completed.

properties.name: cancelledAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this was cancelled.

properties.name: failedAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this failed.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: OpenAIPageableListOfThreadRun
Models.description: The response data for a requested list of items.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always list.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The requested list of items.

properties.name: firstId
properties.description: The first ID represented in this list.

properties.name: lastId
properties.description: The last ID represented in this list.

properties.name: hasMore
properties.description: A value indicating whether there are additional values available not captured in this list.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: ToolOutput
Models.description: The data provided during a tool outputs submission to resolve pending tool calls and allow the model to continue.

properties.name: toolCallId
properties.description: The ID of the tool call being resolved, as provided in the tool calls of a required action from a run.

properties.name: output
properties.description: The output from the tool to be submitted.

properties.name: toolOutputs
properties.description: The list of tool outputs requested by tool calls from the specified run.

Models.name: CreateAndRunThreadOptions
Models.description: The details used when creating and immediately running a new assistant thread.

properties.name: assistantId
properties.description: The ID of the assistant for which the thread should be created.

properties.name: thread
properties.description: The details used to create the new thread.

properties.name: OverrideModelName
properties.description: The overridden model that the assistant should use to run the thread.

properties.name: OverrideInstructions
properties.description: The overridden system instructions the assistant should use to run the thread.

properties.name: OverrideTools
properties.description: The overridden list of enabled tools the assistant should use to run the thread.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: RunStep
Models.description: Detailed information about a single step of an assistant thread run.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'thread.run.step'.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of run step, which can be either message_creation or tool_calls.

properties.name: assistantId
properties.description: The ID of the assistant associated with the run step.

properties.name: threadId
properties.description: The ID of the thread that was run.

properties.name: runId
properties.description: The ID of the run that this run step is a part of.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of this run step.

properties.name: stepDetails
properties.description: The details for this run step.

type.name: RunStepDetails
type.description: An abstract representation of the details for a run step.

message_creation.name: RunStepMessageCreationDetails
message_creation.description: The detailed information associated with a message creation run step.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'message_creation'.

properties.name: messageCreation
properties.description: Information about the message creation associated with this run step.

type.name: RunStepMessageCreationReference
type.description: The details of a message created as a part of a run step.

properties.name: messageId
properties.description: The ID of the message created by this run step.

tool_calls.name: RunStepToolCallDetails
tool_calls.description: The detailed information associated with a run step calling tools.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'tool_calls'.

properties.name: toolCalls
properties.description: A list of tool call details for this run step.

valueType.name: RunStepToolCall
valueType.description: An abstract representation of a detailed tool call as recorded within a run step for an existing run.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the tool call. This ID must be referenced when you submit tool outputs.

code_interpreter.name: RunStepCodeInterpreterToolCall
code_interpreter.description:
A record of a call to a code interpreter tool, issued by the model in evaluation of a defined tool, that
represents inputs and outputs consumed and emitted by the code interpreter.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'code_interpreter'.

properties.name: InternalDetails
properties.description: The details of the tool call to the code interpreter tool.

type.name: InternalCodeInterpreterToolCallDetails
type.description: The detailed information about a code interpreter invocation by the model.

properties.name: input
properties.description: The input provided by the model to the code interpreter tool.

properties.name: outputs
properties.description: The outputs produced by the code interpreter tool back to the model in response to the tool call.

valueType.name: RunStepCodeInterpreterToolCallOutput
valueType.description: An abstract representation of an emitted output from a code interpreter tool.

logs.name: RunStepCodeInterpreterLogOutput
logs.description: A representation of a log output emitted by a code interpreter tool in response to a tool call by the model.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'logs'.

properties.name: logs
properties.description: The serialized log output emitted by the code interpreter.

image.name: RunStepCodeInterpreterImageOutput
image.description: A representation of an image output emitted by a code interpreter tool in response to a tool call by the model.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'image'.

properties.name: image
properties.description: Referential information for the image associated with this output.

type.name: RunStepCodeInterpreterImageReference
type.description: An image reference emitted by a code interpreter tool in response to a tool call by the model.

properties.name: fileId
properties.description: The ID of the file associated with this image.

retrieval.name: RunStepRetrievalToolCall
retrieval.description:
A record of a call to a retrieval tool, issued by the model in evaluation of a defined tool, that represents
executed retrieval actions.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'retrieval'.

properties.name: retrieval
properties.description: The key/value pairs produced by the retrieval tool.

function.name: RunStepFunctionToolCall
function.description:
A record of a call to a function tool, issued by the model in evaluation of a defined tool, that represents the inputs
and output consumed and emitted by the specified function.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'function'.

properties.name: InternalDetails
properties.description: The detailed information about the function called by the model.

type.name: InternalRunStepFunctionToolCallDetails
type.description: The detailed information about the function called by the model.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function.

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: The arguments that the model requires are provided to the named function.

properties.name: output
properties.description: The output of the function, only populated for function calls that have already have had their outputs submitted.

properties.name: lastError
properties.description: If applicable, information about the last error encountered by this run step.

type.name: RunStepError
type.description: The error information associated with a failed run step.

properties.name: code
properties.description: The error code for this error.

properties.name: message
properties.description: The human-readable text associated with this error.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this object was created.

properties.name: expiredAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this item expired.

properties.name: completedAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this completed.

properties.name: cancelledAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this was cancelled.

properties.name: failedAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this failed.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

Models.name: OpenAIPageableListOfRunStep
Models.description: The response data for a requested list of items.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always list.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The requested list of items.

properties.name: firstId
properties.description: The first ID represented in this list.

properties.name: lastId
properties.description: The last ID represented in this list.

properties.name: hasMore
properties.description: A value indicating whether there are additional values available not captured in this list.

Models.name: InternalFileListResponse
Models.description: The response data from a file list operation.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'list'.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The files returned for the request.

valueType.name: OpenAIFile
valueType.description: Represents an assistant that can call the model and use tools.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'file'.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

properties.name: Size
properties.description: The size of the file, in bytes.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: The name of the file.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this object was created.

properties.name: purpose
properties.description: The intended purpose of a file.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: The file data (not filename) to upload.

properties.name: purpose
properties.description: The intended purpose of the file.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: A filename to associate with the uploaded data.

Models.name: InternalFileDeletionStatus
Models.description: A status response from a file deletion operation.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the resource specified for deletion.

properties.name: deleted
properties.description: A value indicating whether deletion was successful.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, which is always 'file'.

Operations.Name: createAssistant
Operations.Description: Creates a new assistant.

Parameters.Name: endpoint
Parameters.Description: An OpenAI endpoint supporting assistants functionality.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: Body parameter.

Operations.Name: InternalGetAssistants
Operations.Description: Gets a list of assistants that were previously created.

Parameters.Name: limit
Parameters.Description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

Parameters.Name: order
Parameters.Description: Sort order by the created_at timestamp of the objects. asc for ascending order and desc for descending order.

Parameters.Name: after
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

Parameters.Name: before
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

Operations.Name: getAssistant
Operations.Description: Retrieves an existing assistant.

Parameters.Name: assistantId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the assistant to retrieve.

Operations.Name: updateAssistant
Operations.Description: Modifies an existing assistant.

Parameters.Name: assistantId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the assistant to modify.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: Body parameter.

Operations.Name: InternalDeleteAssistant
Operations.Description: Deletes an assistant.

Parameters.Name: assistantId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the assistant to delete.

Operations.Name: LinkAssistantFile
Operations.Description: Attaches a previously uploaded file to an assistant for use by tools that can read files.

Parameters.Name: assistantId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the assistant to attach the file to.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Operations.Name: InternalGetAssistantFiles
Operations.Description: Gets a list of files attached to a specific assistant, as used by tools that can read files.

Parameters.Name: assistantId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the assistant to retrieve the list of attached files for.

Parameters.Name: limit
Parameters.Description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

Parameters.Name: order
Parameters.Description: Sort order by the created_at timestamp of the objects. asc for ascending order and desc for descending order.

Parameters.Name: after
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

Parameters.Name: before
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

Operations.Name: getAssistantFile
Operations.Description: Retrieves a file attached to an assistant.

Parameters.Name: assistantId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the assistant associated with the attached file.

Parameters.Name: fileId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the file to retrieve.

Operations.Name: InternalUnlinkAssistantFile
Operations.Description:
Unlinks a previously attached file from an assistant, rendering it unavailable for use by tools that can read
files.

Parameters.Name: assistantId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the assistant from which the specified file should be unlinked.

Parameters.Name: fileId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the file to unlink from the specified assistant.

Operations.Name: createThread
Operations.Description: Creates a new thread. Threads contain messages and can be run by assistants.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: Body parameter.

Operations.Name: getThread
Operations.Description: Gets information about an existing thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread to retrieve information about.

Operations.Name: updateThread
Operations.Description: Modifies an existing thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread to modify.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Operations.Name: InternalDeleteThread
Operations.Description: Deletes an existing thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread to delete.

Operations.Name: createMessage
Operations.Description: Creates a new message on a specified thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread to create the new message on.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Operations.Name: InternalGetMessages
Operations.Description: Gets a list of messages that exist on a thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread to list messages from.

Parameters.Name: limit
Parameters.Description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

Parameters.Name: order
Parameters.Description: Sort order by the created_at timestamp of the objects. asc for ascending order and desc for descending order.

Parameters.Name: after
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

Parameters.Name: before
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

Operations.Name: getMessage
Operations.Description: Gets an existing message from an existing thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread to retrieve the specified message from.

Parameters.Name: messageId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the message to retrieve from the specified thread.

Operations.Name: updateMessage
Operations.Description: Modifies an existing message on an existing thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread containing the specified message to modify.

Parameters.Name: messageId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the message to modify on the specified thread.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Operations.Name: InternalGetMessageFiles
Operations.Description: Gets a list of previously uploaded files associated with a message from a thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread containing the message to list files from.

Parameters.Name: messageId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the message to list files from.

Parameters.Name: limit
Parameters.Description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

Parameters.Name: order
Parameters.Description: Sort order by the created_at timestamp of the objects. asc for ascending order and desc for descending order.

Parameters.Name: after
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

Parameters.Name: before
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

Operations.Name: getMessageFile
Operations.Description: Gets information about a file attachment to a message within a thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread containing the message to get information from.

Parameters.Name: messageId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the message to get information from.

Parameters.Name: fileId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the file to get information about.

Operations.Name: createRun
Operations.Description: Creates a new run for an assistant thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread to run.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Parameters.Name: createRunOptions
Parameters.Description: The details for the run to create.

Operations.Name: InternalGetRuns
Operations.Description: Gets a list of runs for a specified thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread to list runs from.

Parameters.Name: limit
Parameters.Description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

Parameters.Name: order
Parameters.Description: Sort order by the created_at timestamp of the objects. asc for ascending order and desc for descending order.

Parameters.Name: after
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

Parameters.Name: before
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

Operations.Name: getRun
Operations.Description: Gets an existing run from an existing thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread to retrieve run information from.

Parameters.Name: runId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread to retrieve information about.

Operations.Name: updateRun
Operations.Description: Modifies an existing thread run.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread associated with the specified run.

Parameters.Name: runId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the run to modify.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Operations.Name: submitToolOutputsToRun
Operations.Description: Submits outputs from tools as requested by tool calls in a run. Runs that need submitted tool outputs will have a status of 'requires_action' with a required_action.type of 'submit_tool_outputs'.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread that was run.

Parameters.Name: runId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the run that requires tool outputs.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Operations.Name: cancelRun
Operations.Description: Cancels a run of an in progress thread.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread being run.

Parameters.Name: runId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the run to cancel.

Operations.Name: createThreadAndRun
Operations.Description: Creates a new assistant thread and immediately starts a run using that new thread.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: Body parameter.

Operations.Name: getRunStep
Operations.Description: Gets a single run step from a thread run.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread that was run.

Parameters.Name: runId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the specific run to retrieve the step from.

Parameters.Name: stepId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the step to retrieve information about.

Operations.Name: InternalGetRunSteps
Operations.Description: Gets a list of run steps from a thread run.

Parameters.Name: threadId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the thread that was run.

Parameters.Name: runId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the run to list steps from.

Parameters.Name: limit
Parameters.Description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

Parameters.Name: order
Parameters.Description: Sort order by the created_at timestamp of the objects. asc for ascending order and desc for descending order.

Parameters.Name: after
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

Parameters.Name: before
Parameters.Description: A cursor for use in pagination. before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

Operations.Name: InternalListFiles
Operations.Description: Gets a list of previously uploaded files.

Parameters.Name: purpose
Parameters.Description: A value that, when provided, limits list results to files matching the corresponding purpose.

Operations.Name: uploadFile
Operations.Description: Uploads a file for use by other operations.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: The 'content-type' header value, always 'multipart/format-data' for this operation.

Operations.Name: InternalDeleteFile
Operations.Description: Delete a previously uploaded file.

Parameters.Name: fileId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the file to delete.

Operations.Name: getFile
Operations.Description: Returns information about a specific file. Does not retrieve file content.

Parameters.Name: fileId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the file to retrieve.

Operations.Name: getFileContent
Operations.Description: Returns information about a specific file. Does not retrieve file content.

Parameters.Name: fileId
Parameters.Description: The ID of the file to retrieve.
